column4: Anyone able to help with a sound problem? I can hear my mic through my headphones but cant get it to work with actual apps
what is the output of: wget -O alsa-info.sh http://www.alsa-project.org/alsa-info.sh && chmod +x ./alsa-info.sh && ./alsa-info.sh
made alsa info file
want it pastie'd?
http://pastie.org/5070464 is the output

try:  sudo add-apt-repository ppa:ubuntu-audio-dev/ppa; sudo apt-get update;sudo apt-get dist-upgrade; sudo apt-get install --reinstall pavucontrol linux-sound-base alsa-base alsa-utils; killall pulseaudio; rm -r ~/.pulse*
wait 10 seconds, then reboot
i dont have pulse installed
did what you said, still mic doesnt work
did you run the command I gave?
yes
then waited and rebooted
what should i do now? =/
if you run the 'sound' app in dash, are the right input and output devices selected?
you mean alsamixer?
no, in dash there is a sound app.
i have the "mixer" app
search for the word:  sound   and you'll see it, or in the cog menu in top right you may seeit there
ok found it, volume control app with tabs n
in input devices there is nothing listed except under monitors
what shall i do now?
my sound troubleshooting is very basic, keep the pastebin though
:( ok, i asked in #alsa too but got nothing
i just ran ubuntu-bug sound and i got "No pulseaudio fails to detect card"
